text: Hi Carter, not the data sent to the webhook, that’s fine. It’s the valid response HubSpot expects. The example response on the developer page results in an error on the settings page. I’ve tried variations on the example but no joy. Some of the other examples such as dropdown FETCH also have syntax errors but I solved through trial and error. No luck with the button response yet. This is the example JSON

Hi Team,
Please guide me to integrate react js form with HubSpot

Hi Team,
We can track the form submissions by adding the HubSpot tracking code in react js forms
Got it, yeah let me get you that code, one moment
Hi everyone , someone can show me a screenshot of a postman request to this endpoint <https://api.hubapi.com/files/v3/files> i am constantly getting bad request as response and i dont know why
Bruno, I just helped you with this
This really isn't that hard man, please read the docs I just sent you
Here's a screenshot, can you explain what error you're getting
i dont know how to upload the file data
What do you mean?
in the api documentation it says that i need to pass the binary data of a file but i have no clue how to do that
Are you looking at the postman request I just sent?
request body type is form data
all rows in form data are type text except for the file which has a type of FILE
Does this make sense?
yeah i will try to make it like that

Hi!
Somebody knows how to restore a scenario made on Make (integromat) ? I've a connection with HubSpot but I've deleted the wrong scenario :confused:
Thanks!
Don't populate the idProperty parameter
I think that's your issue
Oh really? Interesting. Lemme give that a try.
that did it! Thanks very much.

Hey all - we have a client whose seeing a _very_ slow update time between object creation and the object being available on the HubSpot Search API - roughly 22 seconds. Has anyone else experienced this? Nothing crazy in the request, its just a simple query of the ID after creation
22 Seconds seems excessive (I've never seen this 5 seconds max) but the docs do say in very exactly terms that it will take a moment to update for searches
